basic.floral_language:
Lycoris radiata 
Floriography: sincere, enthusiastic, beautiful
Lycoris radiata is a bulbous plant. Huge flowers, graceful, like dragon claws, has multiple colors, is a beautiful ornamental plant.
Lycoris radiata likes moderate sunlight, suitable under bright scattered light, short summer dormancy. Flowering period in September to October over 2-3 weeks. After the flowers fade, keep the bulbs for germination in the next spring.
basic.blooming: Flowering period September-October, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like moderate light, resistant to half shade, best under bright scattered light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
